result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian W. Graske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian W. Graske

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Brian W. Graske in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1 - NO CONTEST 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Pay fine of $5 plus costs. To be paid within 60 days.
Plea hearing on November 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian W. Graske in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued

BTC: Defendant's attorney will handle the pretrial w/o the defendant present.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant does not appear. Attorney Anne Renc in court. Veronica Isherwood with Intern Taylor Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews the file. 
Atty Renc is not sure where her client is.  Defendant suffers from Lou Gerrigs disease.  Asks for a one week reprieve to see if she can get him to appear. 
State does not object. 

Court will adjourn.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

2:21 p.m.  Defendant now appears with Atty Anne Renc.  Atty Isherwood with Intern Taylor Kraus appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
  Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.
